page.title: 01GENERAL DESCRIPTION
page.content: Combe Martin is a small coastal village situated in North Devon 4 miles from Ilfracombe and 12 miles from Barnstaple.It has a population of about 2200 which is increased in the summer by tourists.Much of our grid consists of farmland and deciduous woodland.The small picturesque village of Berrynarbor is partly contained in our grid.Tourism is a major industry at present,silver mining and slate mining used to be the main industries but are no longer practised.Many people commute to Barnstaple and Ilfracombe to work.Children attend primary schools at Combe Martin and Berrynarbor from the age of 5 to 11 then transfer to the Ilfracombe Comprehensive until 16 or 18.
